result.execSummary:
The defendant NORMAN J SAFFOLD was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Already in custody.  With good time.  With huber if in compliance with jail facility regulations.  The court will hold open the issue of jail credit.
Consecutive to: any other sentence.

Forfeiture and costs to be paid within 60 days from sentence date, unless payment plan is approved.  Penalty for non-payment shall be entry of civil judgment.   Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees.  Send payments to:  Clerk of Courts, Room 110, 415 Jackson Street, P O Box 2808, Oshkosh WI  54903-2808.

records.addlTxt:
1:56 PM Defendant NORMAN J SAFFOLD appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Amanda Lynn Folger in court for the State of Wisconsin. Advised of rights. Defendant waives his/her right to an attorney for this hearing.  Advised of charges & potential penalties.  The State puts the offer on the record, will remove the repeater enhancers.  The DE wants to go to sentencing today.
Recess @ 2:02 for the DE to complete the plea form and waiver of right to an attorney. 
Recalled @ 2:33 same appearances.  DE waives his right to appear in person. Advised of rights. The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.

9:20 AM Defendant NORMAN J SAFFOLD not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Christian A. Gossett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  The jail called, the DE had an incident at the jail and was not able to appear for court today.Bond Continues. The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.
Plea hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

10:59 AM Defendant NORMAN J SAFFOLD not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Tracy Ann Paider in court for the State of Wisconsin.  The DE refused to come to court today from jail.  The Court will schedule another date. The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement. Bond Continues.
Plea hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Absolute sobriety. Do not be on the premises of any bars or taverns. No alcohol consumption or possession. Comply with the Alcohol 24/7 Program. Defendant shall contact (920)232-1919 IMMEDIATELY after their court hearing to schedule an appointment to be set up on the program.  If you violate the rules of 24/7, your bond is immediately revoked and you will be jailed until such time as you can be brought before the court for a bond review hearing.  The defendant shall bring the Alcohol Monitoring Device to every hearing.

2:32 PM Prosecuting attorney Christian A. Gossett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant NORMAN J SAFFOLD appeared by video, in custody. Advised of rights. The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law. The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement. Record closed @ 237
